name: ztnet
description: ztnet is a self-hosted controller and management UI for ZeroTier networks. It lets administrators manage networks, members, and access rules via a central, easy-to-use web dashboard.
features: Network management: Create and configure ZeroTier networks with custom IP ranges and routing rules from a web dashboard.
Member authorization: Approve or deny device join requests and manage which devices can access each network.
Access rules: Define flow rules to control traffic between network members with firewall-like policies.
Network monitoring: View connected members, their IP addresses, and connection status in real-time.
Multi-network support: Manage multiple ZeroTier networks from a single controller instance for different use cases.
User accounts: Create accounts for team members with permissions to manage specific networks or view-only access.
Device metadata: Add descriptions and tags to network members for easier identification and organization.
Route configuration: Set up custom routes to bridge ZeroTier networks with physical networks or other subnets.
DNS management: Configure DNS settings for networks to enable name resolution between members.
Audit logging: Track all network changes, member additions, and administrative actions for security compliance.
API access: Automate network management and member provisioning using REST API endpoints.
Backup and restore: Export network configurations for disaster recovery or migration to other controllers.
